title: An Introduction to Transport Management Systems
headline: Study the scope, benefits and challenges of a transportation management system in this introductory free online course.
description: This course will help you understand how transportation management systems (TMS) can streamline the shipping process for logistics operators and transport service providers. We will discuss the vital operations of the TMS for road, rail, air and inland waterway transport systems. You will also learn to be competent in your strategic responsibilities as a fleet manager, logistics manager or transportation manager. Enrol today.
courseDescription:
A transportation management system (TMS) is a subset of supply chain management (SCM) that deals with the planning, execution and optimisation of the physical movement of goods. TMS allows shippers to automate the processes they have in place and receive valuable insights to save time and reduce spending on future shipments. From quoting to delivery, the shipping freight industry is almost always seeking ways to optimise spending and improve processes. The ultimate goals of using a TMS are thus to improve shipment efficiency, reduce costs, gain real-time supply chain visibility and enhance customer service.

In this free online course, you will learn about the four crucial aspects of transport management and how to handle them efficiently via a TMS. We demonstrate the components of standard TMS software modules. In addition, we will explain the benefits of TMS in supply chain visibility, inventory management and transportation order planning and execution. We will spend time on the skills and training requirements of the transport and logistics manager. We will examine the strategic responsibilities of transport managers in the road haulage sector.

Finally, we discuss the challenges of the transportation industry in the United Kingdom and present the probable solutions in a case study. First, we investigate the management system for train transportation and the role of stakeholders in infrastructure development. Then we will discuss the TMS for airlines and the primary responsibilities of transport managers in health and safety. By taking this course, you will acquire extensive knowledge about the scope and benefits of an efficient management system for the transportation industry. Start learning now!

Start Course Now

Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:

  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • Outline the standard software modules, as well as the benefits and challenges of TMS
    • Discuss the technology skills, people skills, and management skills of a logistics manager
    • Recall some regular terms and acronyms used in road freight transport
    • State the modus for applying for a standard operator’s licence and permit for road transport
    • Discuss the importance of inland waterways in the economic development of rural areas
    • Identify key responsibilities of the transport manager in health and safety management

  • Lesson Summary

  • The key points from this module are:

    Transport Management System (TMS) - A Transportation Management System (TMS) is a subset of Supply Chain Management (SCM) that deals with the planning, execution and optimization of the physical movement of goods.

    TMS is a platform that is designed to streamline the shipping process. It is offered as a module within Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and SCM suites that help organizations move inbound – procurement – and outbound – shipment – freight using tools like route planning and optimization, yard management, carrier management, etc.
  • TMS handles four important operations of transport management:
    ●  Planning             ●  Transportation execution              ●  Transportation follow-up            ●  Measurement
  • Benefits of TMS - A fully deployed TMS can benefit organizations in the following ways:   
    ●  Technological capabilities    ●  Simplify processes    ●  Transport intelligence     ●  Reduce invoice errors
    ●  Track freight    ●  Supply chain visibility & inventory management    ●  Transportation order planning & execution
  • The Challenges of TMS include the following:
    ●  Keeping quotes organized      ●  Selecting the best carrier         ●  Tracking shipments      ●  Gathering insights
  • What is SaaS? SaaS stands for at least three different “as-a-service” offerings. The original use of the acronym was to refer to Software as a Service. The term is now being used for Storage as a Service and Security as a Service.
